definition: time flies (idiom)
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]
as/as if/such as
shuttle (textiles)/to move back and fro

sentences.english: Time passes like flowing water, years if shuttle.
Many people say time speeds up as we age.
sentences.chinese: 許多人說，時間如逝歲月如梭，把我們給催老了。

sentences.english: As time goes by, soon 2010 will be history.
sentences.chinese: 歲月如梭，轉眼2010年即將成爲過去。

sentences.english: Years Rusuo, time flies, six primary school life, a brief span.
sentences.chinese: 歲月如梭，光陰似箭，六年小學生活，彈指一揮間。

definition: loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
masquerade
sullen/to scowl miserably
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
red in the face/extremely angry
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
commendation speech/eulogy/ode
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to miss/to long for
